problem_description:
Build a minimal 'News Fetcher' web app.

Tech stack:
- Frontend: React + TypeScript
- Backend: Python FastAPI
- Validation: Pydantic v2
- DB/ORM: SQLite + SQLModel
- E2E testing: Playwright (preferred) or Cypress

User flow (UI):
- One page with:
  1) text input labeled 'Category'
  2) button labeled 'Fetch'
  3) results list
  4) a small status line showing one of: FRESH, CACHED, PARTIAL
- User types a category (e.g., 'science', 'sports') and clicks Fetch.
- UI renders up to 10 items, sorted by published_at descending (newest first).
- Each item shows: title, short description, source name, published_at, and a clickable link to the article URL.

Backend behavior:
- Endpoint: POST /news/fetch
- Request body: { "category": "<string>" }
- The backend MUST attempt to fetch real news from the internet for the given category.
- 'Latest' definition: items with published_at within the last 7 days including today (use UTC; filter: published_at >= now_utc - 7 days).
- Target: return exactly 10 items that satisfy the 'latest' definition, sorted by published_at desc.

Retry + fallback (no infinite waiting):
- The backend must retry fetching if it cannot obtain 10 valid items.
- Max attempts: 5 total attempts per request.
- Backoff between attempts: 0.5s, 1s, 2s, 4s (stop after 5th attempt).
- If after retries the backend still cannot return 10 valid items:
  - Query the database for the most recent stored items for that category that are within the last 7 days.
  - Return up to 10 cached items (sorted by published_at desc).
  - If the DB also has fewer than 10, return whatever exists (0–9).

Response contract:
- Response JSON:
  {
    "status": "FRESH" | "CACHED" | "PARTIAL",
    "attempts": <int 1..5>,
    "category": "<string>",
    "items": [
      {
        "id": "<uuid>",
        "title": "<string>",
        "description": "<string>",
        "url": "<string>",
        "source_name": "<string>",
        "published_at": "<iso datetime>",
        "fetched_at": "<iso datetime>"
      }
    ]
  }
- Status rules:
  - FRESH: returned 10 items and at least 1 of them was newly fetched from the internet in this request.
  - CACHED: returned items exclusively from the DB because internet fetch failed to produce 10 after retries.
  - PARTIAL: returned fewer than 10 items (even after using DB fallback).

Persistence rules:
- Store every fetched item in SQLite.
- De-duplication: unique by url. If url already exists, do not insert a new row.
- Also store the category association so cached queries are per-category.

Validation rules:
- category: trimmed, lowercase, length 2..32, allowed characters: letters, digits, space, hyphen.
- url: must be a valid http(s) URL.
- published_at: must parse as datetime.

E2E test (closed loop, real internet):
- Start frontend + backend locally.
- Browser test steps:
  1) open the app
  2) type 'science' in Category
  3) click Fetch
  4) wait until status line becomes one of FRESH/CACHED/PARTIAL and results render
  5) assert the UI renders between 1 and 10 items
  6) for each rendered item assert: title visible, description visible, link has non-empty href starting with http, published_at is displayed
  7) assert each rendered published_at is within the last 7 days (UTC) relative to test runtime

Out of scope:
- Auth/users, pagination, saving favorites, complex styling, admin panels.
